section.title: Overview
section.para: The features gathered under the term of Reporting are related to the actions taken by a bank playing an active role in a Trade Finance transaction existing in as a product record.

All the products (Import and Export Letters of Credit, Shipping Guarantees, Financing Requests, Export and Import Documentary Collections, Banker's Guarantees, Issued and Received Standby LCs, Fund Transfers and Inward Remittances) available in the system can be manipulated within the Reporting Edition module, and the bank's actions on these records can be split in three categories:

Reply to an initiation submitted to the bank by one of its customers. Under the term initiation, we understand all the new events on any product representing a new transactional communication from the client to the bank. As examples, it will typically include the request for issuance of a new Letter of Credit, a new amendment of its terms, the creation of a new Guarantee, a new Financing Request, the delivery of new collection instructions by a drawer to his remitting bank or for instance any update on the products supported through the free format message transaction event.

Creation of a new Reporting message on an existing transaction record . As opposed to the previous one, this communication is initiated by the bank handling the record and used to notify the customer of a new event that has occurred on his transaction. An example could be for the issuing bank of a Letter of Credit to send an advice of discrepancies to the importer when the documents have been received from the negotiating bank, or alternatively to trace its customer for the payment of a sight bill under an LC.

Creation by the bank of a completely new transaction record . This is available for the notification to the export customer of a new Export Letter of Credit (Commercial or Standby) issued in his favour, or the notification to a client of a new Import Documentary Collection for which it is the designated drawee.
Each of those categories represents an option appearing as a menu item of the screen, that can itself be reached from the bank user's home page.

Note that for each type of reporting, the capability of introducing several users to validate the message sent back to the customer is available. This feature allows the bank to set up an authorisation matrix for its users to implement a four-eyes principle or a jurisdiction based on the amounts reported.
This mechanism is the same as the one available on the customer side to control several levels of controls on the transaction submissions.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: The pending records seen from the bank standpoint are the transaction events which have been successfully submitted to the bank by its customers. Those are records now waiting for an acknowledgement by the bank's Trade Services which has to decide if the related requests can be approved and hence processed in the back-office operations of the bank.

As long as a pending record has not been approved by the bank through this reporting option, the record is not seen as Existing (in case it is a creation of transaction), Amended or Updated on the client side. In other words, its new or updated details have not been committed to the master expression of this transaction record as long as the acknowledgement has not been applied.
The mechanism of generation of the reply and the associated workflow for the bank user is the following:

listitem.para: The bank user reviews the list of such pending records whether from his home page or from the consolidated list.
The user selects a record by clicking on its assigned reference number to see more details than the summary appearing in the list.
An input form is returned with the following capabilities:

The user can review the details of the event as well as the full details of the transaction itself. He can print or export these details as a PDF format and leave the form for now if some processing / validation is required in the back-office before being able to generate the acknowledgement message.

After reviewing the details, and eventually after the back-office has processed the request, the first part of the reporting form lets the bank user enter the text details of the message that will be sent as an acknowledgement to the customer together with eventual attachments.

note.para: If the electronic details of the transaction record need to be altered as a consequence of the processing by the back-office (for instance after some additional modifications were provided by the user through the phone), it is advised to convey these modifications in a subsequent reporting message (incepted from the Existing Records menu item). Indeed, it will keep the consistency between the data of the back-office and the kind of file that will be displayed to the customer as part of his reporting. And since it is an additional reporting message, the customer still has access in the history of the transaction to the original details he has submitted as well as the updated view provided by the bank through the second message.

section.para: The following sections will detail the various interfaces provided to the bank user for these steps.

section.title: List Pending Records
section.para: The list of pending records that the bank user can access to review the items pending for the bank's acknowledgement and eventually add the required reporting message can be inquired from two different places in :

listitem.para: Since these transactional messages are among the most urgent things for a bank user to consider in order to provide the customer with a fast response to his business requests, the home page of for all bank users is showing in its top portion a list of the most recent transaction records received from their customers. In its principle, this list is quite similar to the Trade Events component available on the home page of the client users to remind them of any outstanding transactions or the recent notifications sent by the bank. In order to avoid a too long display within the home page of the bank user, the list is limited by default to 10 items, and this number can be parameterised through the relevant properties file. Each element in the list can be clicked on to rapidly open the reporting form and show its full details.
The screen is the place to go to if the complete list of pending records needs to be inquired. It can be accessed from the Pending Records menu item and its List of Records sub-section.

section.para: The latter list is also offering additional features in terms of filters since the search can be adjusted to return only a given set of pending transaction records.

The fields available to adjust the search pattern are the assigned System Id number of the transaction record, the abbreviated name of the customers' Company, and eventually the Product (any of the ones offering an input capability on the client side). Wildcards can be used for these fields to broaden the scope of the search.

Once a bank user has already started to work on a pending record and has whether saved it or already tried a submission, this record will not appear in this list anymore but instead in the Retrieve Draft or Retrieve Unsigned sub-menu items.
The columns returned in the list of Pending Records are the following:

entry.para: Field
Description
The unique assigned reference number for the file involved in the pending transaction event.
The abbreviated name of the customers' companies from which the transaction event has been sent.
The type of the transaction involved can have one of the following values:

listitem.para: New (for an initiation of file, such as the creation of new Letter of Credit issuance, a new Shipping Guarantee, Financing Request, Banker's Guarantee, Fund Transfer, Export Collection instruction, Inward Remittance)
Amend (for an amendment of Import Letter of Credit (Commercial or Standby) or Banker's Guarantee, whether Inc for increase, Dec for decrease or Terms)
Message (for a free format / update message on any of the products)

entry.para: The currency of the transaction record.
The amount specific to the transaction event appears in this column.

For a creation of a new transaction, it shows the total amount. For an amendment of Import Letter of Credit or Banker's Guarantee whereby an increase or decrease of amount has been entered by the customer, the difference in amount is shown. In all the other cases, including the free format / update messages of all products, nothing is displayed in the column since no amount is directly tied to the transaction event.

This column shows the date of release of the pending transaction from the customer site. In order to avoid consistency issues between the various time zones of the bank and its customers (and even within a given customer company), this release date is set according to the time zone of the server.

section.para: As for all the lists throughout the application, each column can be sorted according to an ascending or descending order.
When clicking on a System Id number, the bank user enters the Reporting form of the transaction event to review its details and eventually straight away prepare the bank's acknowledgement message.

If the bank officer wishes to export the list of pending records to build customized reports with his own office productivity tool, he can select the CSV or the SpreadSheet output format for the query. The first option outputs the data in an external Comma-Separated-Values file and the second one as a file compatible with a spreadsheet application such as Microsoft Excel.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: The option Retrieve Draft is displaying a list of all the Reporting Messages from Pending Records which have already been prepared and saved by the bank input user, but whether not completed or simply not submitted back to the customer because of a lack of authorisation in the profile of this potential submitter.

The list presented to the user is displaying all such records. A search can be performed on the items displayed by adjusting a search pattern on the assigned System Id for the file, Company or related Product, as well as the bank input User Name who would have previously saved the current Reporting Message. The usage of wildcards is allowed for all editable fields.

The columns returned are the System Id, Company, Type, Currency, Amount, bank input User Name and previous Input Date of the files matching the search criteria, and the user can decide to sort the display to show each column in an ascending or descending order.
The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are re-opening the Reporting Message in input mode.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: The option Retrieve Unsigned is returning a list of all the Reporting Messages from Pending Records that have been completed internally but not yet submitted back to the customer because of a lack of authorisation in the bank user's profile.

The list presented to the bank user is displaying all such records pending for final submission on the bank side. A search can be performed on the items displayed by adjusting a search pattern on the same criteria as for the Retrieve Draft option, and the same columns are returned.

The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are presenting the transaction details of this Reporting Message in a non-editable form, with the capability of reviewing the data and performing the actual submission.

For the user holding the appropriate permission in his profile, the list also offers the capability to perform the submission of multiple records in a single operation. For that purpose, a check box is available with each record of the list and a button at the end of the screen triggers the submission of all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned to the user with the list of items which have been successfully sent to the customer, next to the list of the records pending from an additional validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Pending Record Reporting Form
section.para: The input form displayed in the bank user interface after the selection of a pending record is composed of two distinct sections. If the bank officer decides to post-pone the generation of the reporting message and hence only review the details of the event, he can typically leave the form clicking on the Cancel button.
The first section of the form is summarising the key information related to the transaction event. For all products, the following elements are displayed:

The icon at the right hand-side of the Transaction Details title opens a popup window specific to each product and containing two sections:

listitem.para: The first one shows the details specific to the current transaction event and could for instance typically include the additional details or file uploaded by the customer when creating a Message.
The second part of the screen presents the current complete master details of the transaction record.

entry.para: The name of the company from which the transaction event has been initiated.
This is a reminder of the product involved in the current transaction, whether Import Letter of Credit, Shipping Guarantee or Financing Request.
The unique assigned reference number of the transaction file.

This field reminds the bank user of the type of the current transaction. New, Amend (Increase, Decrease or Terms) or Message are the values matching the transaction types available within the client front-end.
The release date and time as recorded in the server time zone at the moment that the customer had released the transaction event to the bank.

For some products, the actual issue date of the transaction must be entered by the bank upon its approval. This is the case for the LC, SI, SG and BG (only when the recipient bank is also the issuing bank).

When applicable the date entered must be a valid date and will be checked against an eventual Expiry Date. The content of the field can be left empty if the bank does not accept the client's initiation.
In case of an LC or BG amendment, a default amendment number must be set by the bank officer. The only constraint imposed by the system is for the field to be a valid number (between 0 and 999).

Also in the case of an LC or BG amendment, the date specified by the client can be adjusted by the bank officer in the bank's acknowledgement. The system checks that the date is well-formed and after an eventual issue date (LC only).

When the bank user decides to reply to the customer, the status of the acknowledgment needs to be set in this list box offering the values Approved to indicate that the request has been successfully processed by the bank or Rejectedto notify the rejection of the request.

This field is only available when the transaction event is a creation of new file. In such a case, the bank must enter here the reference number assigned by the bank's back-office to the record. The text field is limited to 20 alphanumeric characters.
In case the transaction is rejected, the bank user can type any string that would reasonably be interpreted as a non-reference by the customer (e.g. the keyword None)

A maximum of 30 lines of 65 characters can be entered in this text field. It is supposed to contain any explanation or details given by the bank to indicate the characteristics of the completion of the reporting.
For example, for an approved transaction, the bank could provide a generic message of acknowledgment followed by the list of charges and commissions collected under the transaction.
For a rejection, the bank could enter some text to explain the reason behind its refusal to complete the transaction as requested by the customer.
Note that a list of pre-defined phrases within the bank can be called through a popup window to fetch common text clauses.
Up to 5 files can be attached by the bank user to his reporting message in order to give further details to the customer under the form of downloadable file attachments.

Any file accessible from the bank user workstation could be sent together with the transaction. This feature could typically be used to attach an electronic debit advice as a PDF or MS-Word document, or a copy of an acknowledged SWIFT MT700 message.

section.para: Note that in the case of the reply to a transactional message, the bank user can also edit the complete details of the current record. In such a case, no client instruction can be overridden since he can only use a free format input field, and there is therefore no risk for the bank to alter the transaction details as part of the same transaction event. This feature will be further explained in chapter 2.3.5 below (third section of the screen for the Existing Record Reporting Feature).
The last elements of the interface appearing on the top of the page are the operations provided to the bank user within the page:

All the data entered in the form (including the status, eventually back-office reference, comment as well as all the optional modifications of the transaction details) is saved as draft (or uncontrolled) that means that the reporting message will remain as a pending record without being sent back to the customer for now. No control on the mandatory fields is performed at this stage.
The bank user chooses this action when all the requested (and mandatory) details of the reporting message have been entered and the resulting file is ready for submission back to the customer.

Depending on the jurisdiction profile of the bank user (and in particular the amount he is authorised to validate without an additional signature), the transaction record will whether remain within the bank workspace as unsigned or be sent to the customer.
By choosing this operation, the bank user will leave the current page and will be brought back to the general menu.
The user chooses this operation to open a popup window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: For various reasons throughout the life of an International Trade transaction, the bank handling the file (typically as the issuing bank of an LC, SI, SG, TF or FT transaction, the recipient or issuing bank for a BG, the advising bank for an EL, SR, the remitting bank for an EC or IR or the presenting for an IC) may need to send various transactional messages to its customers.

A typical usage of this feature would be the capability for the bank to notify the exporter of an amendment on a Export Letter of Credit notified previously in his favour, or for example to forward an advice of discrepancies to the applicant of an Import Letter of Credit.

More generally, the bank can use the generation of reporting from an existing record each time it needs to send a message to the customer and when this event is not a reply to something initiated by the client (in which case it would be accessed through the Pending Records module).
The flow to create these events is similar to the one described for that previous module. And in particular, the concept of authorisation and Save/Submit stages also applies.

section.title: List Existing Records
section.para: The bank user is provided with a search screen to easily access the transaction record that requires to be updated under the reporting. This screen is initially blank and only displays a search form. Since the consolidated list of existing transaction records for all products and all customers of the bank could be fairly huge, the user is initially requested to adjust the search criteria before submitting his search request.
The following data items can be set through the input fields of the search form:

entry.para: Field
Description
The unique assigned reference number. A wildcard can be used in the search string.

The internal reference identifier as attached to the transaction by the bank during its inception. It is usually referred to as the Trade Services back-office reference. This field supports the wildcards.
The abbreviated name of the customer's company. Wildcards can be used.
Any of the products handled by can be used to further filter the list of records returned.

section.para: The columns returned in the list of Existing Records are the following:

entry.para: Field
Description
The unique assigned reference number.
The reference originally assigned by the bank.
The abbreviated name of the customers' companies.
This field shows the current status of the product. The possible values are the following:

listitem.para: New indicates the state of any product right after its successful initiation,
Amended is typically the state of a Letter of Credit or a Banker's Guarantee after an amendment has been applied,
Updated is the generic state generally given by the bank as a follow-up to a free format message transaction initiated by the customer.

Other statuses are available on the bank side and can be used by the Trade Services team when generating a reporting message. The following chapters will provide further details on these custom product status codes. Hence the state born by a transaction record could also be Accepted, Settled, Cancelled, Extended or Purged.

entry.para: The currency code of the transaction record.
The master amount of the transaction record (hence not necessarily in sync. with the current outstanding amount).

section.para: Each column can also be sorted in ascending or descending order.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: The usual Retrieve Draft option is displaying a list of all the Reporting Messages from Existing Records which have been already prepared and saved by a bank input user, but whether not completed or simply not submitted back to the customer because of insufficient privileges to do so.

The list presented to the bank user is displaying all such records. A search can be performed on the items displayed by adjusting a pattern on the assigned System Id for the product record, Company or related Product, as well as the bank input User Name who would have previously saved the current Reporting Message. The usage of wildcards is allowed for all editable fields.

The columns returned are the System Id, Company, Type, Currency, Amount, bank input User Name and previous Input Date of the files matching the search criteria, and the usual sort facility is provided.
The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are re-opening the Reporting Message in input mode.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: The option Retrieve Unsigned is returning a list of all the Reporting Messages from Pending Records which have been completed internally but not yet submitted back to the customer because of a lack of authorisation in the bank user's profile (note that the records which were simply saved are not displayed in the list, and are instead accessible only from the Retrieve Draft sub-menu item).
A search in the list can be performed on the items displayed by adjusting a search pattern on the same criteria as for the Retrieve Draft option, and the same columns are returned.

The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are presenting the details of this Reporting Message in progress in a non-editable form, with the capability of reviewing the data and performing the actual submission.

For the user holding the appropriate permission in his profile, the list also offers the capability to perform the submission of multiple records in a single operation. For that purpose, a check box is available with each record of the list and a button at the end of the screen triggers the submission of all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned to the user with the list of items which have been successfully sent to the customer, next to the list of the records pending from an additional validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Existing Record Reporting Form
section.para: The form dedicated to the generation of new Bank towards Customer transactional message on an existing record is split in three main section.
The first section of the form is summarising the key information related to the existing file as it appears in its master record. The following fields are displayed for all products:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
The icon at the right hand-side of the Transaction Details title opens a popup window specific to each product and containing the current complete master details of the transaction record.
The name of the company owning the transaction record (being whether its applicant, its beneficiary, its drawee or its drawer).

This is a reminder of the product involved in the current transaction, whether Import or Export Letter of Credit, Shipping Guarantee, Financing Request, Issued or Received Standby LC, Banker's Guarantee, Export or Import Documentary Collection, Fund Transfer or Inward Remittance.
The unique assigned reference number of the transaction file.
The reference initially attached by the bank to the file. It is usually referred to as the back-office reference.
This field always shows Reporting in the current context. It is a type associated with the event of a Bank towards Customer reporting message.

section.para: The second section provides the bank user with several input fields to enter the details specific to the new event currently generated:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

When generating such a new message, the bank user will need to set the new status of the transaction record as eventually modified by the current event. This new status is the key information shown to the customer user when browsing the bank reporting or the history of the transaction. It is supposed to represent the state of the record after that event.
Note that no control of functional consistency is performed by the system, and it is therefore up to the bank user to choose the appropriate code.
The user can choose within the following list of possible values in the standard version of (with sample interpretations):

listitem.para: Updated: a generic term to indicate that the record has been updated.
Amended : this status should be used only for acknowledgement or notification of Import or Export Commercial or Standby Letters of Credit and Banker's Guarantee amendments.
Extended: typically applicable to an extension of maturity date for a financing transaction.
Accepted: this could be used to notify the customer of an acceptance of bill.
Settled: to indicate any kind of principle settlement on any kind of product (for instance the full final settlement of Trust Receipt).
Partially Settled: same as above but reserved for partial settlements.
Cancelled: typically for the redemption and cancellation of a Shipping Guarantee.
Released: this status should typically be associated with a Banker's Guarantee whose release has been pronounced.
Discrepant: this status can be chosen by the bank on an Import LC when it notifies discrepancies detected on a set of documents presented.

Sight Payment: typically selected by the issuing bank of a Commercial or Standby LC when there is a presentation of documents with an underlying full sight payment, and if the presentation is clean or alternatively when the applicant has given his acceptance on discrepancies previously notified.
Partial Sight Payment: same as above for a partial payment.

Purged: this is a technical code which will have a real impact on the file since the user will not be able to further update this record. It should be applied by the bank when it has purged the transaction in its own back-office system.
Rejected: also a technical code that can be used by the bank user to notify any kind of rejected action not applied to the record's master details.

entry.para: This field is only applicable for the Commercial and Standby Letters of Credit, both on the Import/Issued and Export/Received sides, as well as the Export Collections. When the status of the transaction is set to Discrepant, Accepted, Full Sight Payment, Partial Sight Payment, Full Settlement or Partial Settlement, the amount of the related presentation of documents or alternatively the payment itself must be specified here.
The outstanding amount of the transaction is updated accordingly only when the selected status is Accepted, Full Sight Payment or Partial Sight Payment.

This field is only applicable to a Commercial or Standby Letter of Credit, both on the Import/Issued and Export/Received sides, as well as the Export Collections, whose status is set to Discrepant, Accepted, Full Sight Payment, Partial Sight Payment, Full Settlement or Partial Settlement.
It means the maturity date of the payment related to the presentation in the case of the choices Discrepant and Accepted.
For the other choices, it means the actual date of payment / settlement.
This field must be a properly formatted date and is mandatory when selecting any one of those statuses except Discrepant, Full Settlement or Partial Settlement for which it is optional.
The system will also automatically push this maturity date inside the company's calendar when selecting a status equal to Accepted, Full Sight Payment or Partial Sight Payment.
A maximum of 30 lines of 65 characters can be entered in this text field to describe what the reporting is about.
Up to 5 files can also be attached by the bank user to his reporting message in order to give further details as downloadable file attachments.
A title of up to 255 characters for the attachment.
The bank user can select a file to attach.

section.para: The third section that can be accessed from the Existing Record Reporting Form is made of a set of input fields letting the bank user eventually alter all the transaction details of the file for which an event is currently prepared.

Due to its impact on potentially the whole set of data constituting a record, this feature should be handled carefully. This feature is very useful (and even mandatory in some cases) if any data has changed during the processing of the file by the back-office, hence ensuring that the customer will electronically receive a fully updated view of his transaction file.

In order to access the form, the bank user must initially click on the Edit Transaction Details hyperlink. After the acknowledgement of a confirmation message, the data fields pertaining to the current product that were originally hidden appear in the user interface. The content of this extended form and the fields available are detailed in the product specific chapters to be found in a next section.
The list of operations available to submit the job done within this page is the same as the one described for the Pending Records.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: Compared to the two previous options, the Export Notification is dedicated to a single product and a single type of event: the goal of this feature is to provide the user of the bank acting as the advising bank in a Letter of Credit transaction with a front-end to create new Export Letter of Credit notifications to his customers (which are therefore the beneficiaries of the LC).
In order to offer a consistent interface with a straight learning curve for the bank user, the principles of this front-end are similar to the two previous transactional options.

section.title: From Scratch
section.para: With the option From Scratch, a new Export Letter of Credit Notification record will be created through a blank form.

section.title: Free Format
section.para: Since the terms of an Export Letter of Credit received from the issuing bank are often expressed as a large text, or typically under the form of a unstructured letter, the Free Format option is introduced to let the bank user notify such free format instructions to his customer. The core of the form available when selecting this option is therefore a large narrative text field.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: The option Retrieve Draft is displaying a list of all the new Export Notifications which have already been prepared and saved by the bank input user, but whether not completed or simply not submitted back to the customer because of a lack of authorisation in the profile of this potential submitter.
The list presented to the user is displaying all such records. The same search criteria are presented to the bank user and the same columns are returned as for the two previous types of reporting.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: The option Retrieve Unsigned is returning a list of all the new Export Notifications that have been completed internally but not yet submitted back to the customer because of a lack of authorisation in the bank user's profile.
The same option and results as the ones described for the other types of reporting are available for this list.

For the user holding the appropriate permission in his profile, the list also offers the capability to perform the submission of multiple records in a single operation. For that purpose, a check box is available with each record of the list and a button at the end of the screen triggers the submission of all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned to the user with the list of items which have been successfully sent to the customer, next to the list of the records pending from an additional validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: This option is very similar to the one dedicated to the Export Letter of Credit and described in the previous chapter.

Its goal is to provide the user of the bank acting as the advising bank in a Standby Letter of Credit transaction with a front-end to create new Standby LC notifications to his customers who are the beneficiaries of the Standby LC received (SR).
The various ways to perform the initiation of the Standby LC are the following.

section.title: Standard
section.para: This Standard option provides the bank user with a form similar to the one obtained with the From Scratch option on a new Export Letter of Credit: the details of the Standby LC notification are entered in a blank form with structured fields dedicated to Letter of Credit details.

section.title: Free Format
section.para: Since the terms of a Standby Letter of Credit received from the issuing bank are often expressed as a large text, or typically under the form of a unstructured letter, the Free Format option is introduced to let the bank user notify such free format instructions to his customer. The core of the form available when selecting this option is therefore a large narrative text field.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: The option Retrieve Draft is displaying a list of all the new Standby LC notifications which have already been prepared and saved by the bank input user, but whether not completed or simply not submitted back to the customer because of a lack of authorisation in the profile of this potential submitter.
The list presented to the user is displaying all such records. The same search criteria are presented to the bank user and the same columns are returned as for the previous types of reporting.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: The option Retrieve Unsigned is returning a list of all the new Standby LC notifications that have been completed internally but not yet submitted back to the customer because of a lack of authorisation in the bank user's profile.
The same option and results as the ones described for the other types of reporting are available for this list.

For the user holding the appropriate permission in his profile, the list also offers the capability to perform the submission of multiple records in a single operation. For that purpose, a check box is available with each record of the list and a button at the end of the screen triggers the submission of all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned to the user with the list of items which have been successfully sent to the customer, next to the list of the records pending from an additional validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Received Standby LC Reporting Form
section.para: As for the Export Notifications, no list is involved in the transaction, and the selection of the Standby LC Standard or Free Format sub-menu items automatically opens an input form to let the bank user generate this type of bank reporting.
The first section summarises some key information related to the current task:

section.title: Introduction
section.para: A Letter of Credit (LC) or Documentary Credit is a banking mechanism that allows importers to offer secure terms to exporters. All letters of credit are a payment undertaking given by a bank (issuing bank) on behalf of the buyer (applicant) to pay a seller (beneficiary) a given amount of money on presentation of specified documents representing the supply of goods within specific time limits. These documents conforming to terms and conditions set out in the letter of credit are to be presented at a specified place.

The form described in this section is dealing with the business details of this LC product on which the bank of the current user acts as the issuing bank. It can be activated through the Edit Transaction Details feature found in the reporting page of the Pending and Existing Records when the product record edited is such an Import LC.

section.title: Issued Standby Letter of Credit Form
Introduction
section.para: Even if it is based on a flow of documents often related to a business transaction between a buyer and seller, the Standby Letter of Credit is not specifically related to the movement of goods.

It acts more like a guarantee and it therefore allows the beneficiary to receive a payment from the issuing bank in the event of default on a contract, provided that the complying documents (usually a sight draft) are presented. A Standby LC can be governed whether by the UCP 500 rules or the more specific ISP 98 practices.

The Issued Standby LC focuses on the applicant side and is therefore very similar to the Import Letter of Credit seen previously. The key difference is that it can also be issued through a fairly unstructured form providing a large text area for the client to enter the details of the requested Standby LC.

When the bank edits a reporting message on this product, the form will automatically inherits from the one used for its original issuance: if the Standby LC was initiated through a standard form, the same form as for an Import LC is displayed; if it was issued as a set of free format terms, the related form is loaded.
The following chapters focus on that free format option. For further details on the structured form, you may refer to the Import Letter of Credit section.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: A Financing Request or Trade Financing (TF) is a transaction issued in by the client and sent to a designated bank whereby that import or export customer is requiring some form of financing in the scope of an International Trade transaction.

The scope of the module is quite generic in the sense that it aims at providing transaction handling capabilities for various types of financing such as Import Loans, Export Discounts on a presentation of documents by an exporter, as well as Trust Receipts or for instance Export Pre-Financing.

The form described in this section is dealing with the business details of this Financing Request product on which the bank of the current user acts as the lending bank (also called TF issuing bank in the remainder of this document). It can be activated through the Edit Transaction Details feature found in the reporting page of the Pending and Existing Records when the product record edited is such a request for financing.
This large input form preloaded with the current master details of the transaction is split in various sections.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: The Documentary Collection managed in is a method of payment used in international trade whereby the exporter entrusts the handling of trade documents to banks and gives the banks instructions concerning the release of these documents to the importer.
The Export Documentary Collection refers to the export side of such transactions where the bank plays the role of the remitting bank and where the client is the drawer of the collection.
Two types of Export Collections are handled:

listitem.para: The Regular Collections where the remitting bank will be responsible for the sending of the documents to the presenting bank on the import side,
The Direct Collections where the drawer himself ships the documents to the presenting bank and only instruct his bank to handle the remaining of the transaction.

section.title: Generation of the Cover Letter
section.para: During the initial receipt of the Direct Collection instructions by the remitting bank, can be used by the bank user to optionally generate and submit to his customer the actual cover letter that he will use to send directly the documents to the presenting bank. This method circumvents a classical flaw of the direct collections whereby the remitting bank is reluctant to provide its customer with blank forms bearing its letterhead without any control on them.
The built-in flow for the generation and attachment of the cover letter is the following:

listitem.para: The bank receives the request through the middle-office screen and prepares the reporting bearing its approval of the collection instructions.

While performing this task on a direct collection record, the bank officer can decide to automatically generate and attach the related cover letter. This is done in Input mode by checking a dedicated check box in the Reporting Message Details section of the screen. At any time, with the icon
, the bank input user can call a preview of the letter available as an Acrobat PDF file.

When the Save / Submit button is hit by the bank user, the server-side logic performs the generation of a new attachment and adds it to the list of the files eventually attached to the reporting message. This PDF file becomes the original copy that the customer will receive, and subsequently print and attach to the documents sent to the import side.

section.title: Banker's Guarantee Form
section.para: Introduction

The notion of Banker's Guarantee in refers to the contracts by which a third party (the guarantor, which here will most likely be the bank itself) undertakes to be responsible for specific success and, in particular, to accept the damages which can result from a specific corporate transaction.

implements the applicant side of the customer to the bank relationships. The bank involved here is considered as simply the recipient of the customer's request or eventually also the actual issuing bank of the guarantee.
The form described below reflects this role and presents the business data available to the bank user to follow-up with the Banker's Guarantee record initiated by its clients.

section.title: Fund Transfer Product
section.para: The Fund Transfer product is a simple Cash Management feature available in to let the customer enter the details of a fund transfer request, for which the bank can subsequently send an acknowledgement upon successful completion. It comes with two built-in types: Internal which is typically used when funds need to be transferred between two accounts of the same company, and Outgoing when an external beneficiary needs to be specified as the recipient of the fund transfer together with an eventual banking institution acting as an intermediary.

Compared to the other products handled by the , the module is associated with a single event (the submission of the transfer request and the bank's reply), and hence the bank does not need to specifically interact with its details for further reporting.

Therefore the bank side of the Fund Transfer product is limited to a review of the instructions sent by the client and the interaction is limited to the common input fields available for every reporting message generated by the bank from a pending customer request. You may refer to the chapter detailing this common function for further details.
